intro: Decaspermum vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Decaspermum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Decaspermum vitiense is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
